verses.roman:
caitanya-mahimā jāni e saba siddhānte
citta dṛḍha hañā lāge mahimā-jñāna haite

synonyms: caitanya-mahimā—the glory of Lord Caitanya Mahāprabhu; jāni—I know; e—these; saba—all; siddhānte—by the conclusions; citta—the mind; dṛḍha—firm; hañā—becoming; lāge—becomes fixed; mahimā-jñāna—knowledge of the greatness; haite—from.
translation: By such conclusive studies I know the glories of Lord Caitanya. Only by knowing these glories can one become strong and fixed in attachment to Him.

purport.content: One can know the glories of Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu only by reaching, in knowledge, a conclusive decision about Śrī Kṛṣṇa, strengthened by bona fide study of the conclusions of the ācāryas.
